conclusion: Analyze the behavior of light beams interacting with a hemispherical glass brick.
Hemispherical glass brick placed on horizontal plane AB with flat surface AB upwards and curved surface downwards. C is midpoint of AB, OO' is perpendicular to AB through point C.
Light beams a and b incident perpendicularly onto flat surface AB from air, intersect at point P inside the glass brick.
Light b bends more than light a due to higher refractive index, travels further inside glass brick.
Diffraction occurs when light waves spread out through smaller apertures.
Light b is more likely to exhibit diffraction than light a because it travels further inside the glass.
Conclude that light b is more likely to exhibit diffraction than light a.
